perturbation.original_text: All material submitted to Distributor will be provided by Distributor to S2K with comments or approval no later than three business days after receipt in AdLit.
perturbation.changed_text: All material submitted to Distributor will be provided by Distributor to S2K with comments or approval no later than ten business days after receipt in AdLit.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by extending the timeframe for Distributor to provide feedback on marketing materials. This creates ambiguity in the contract about the expected turnaround time. This could lead to disputes regarding deadlines for marketing campaign launches.

perturbation.original_text:
If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within one business day of Distributor’ receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
a) A charge of $250 will apply to each request for expedited review, in addition to FINRA filing fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within one business day of Distributor’ receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
a) No charge will apply to each request for expedited review, in addition to FINRA filing fees.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text contradicts the original by stating there is no charge for expedited review. This change creates confusion over payment obligations and could lead to billing disputes.

perturbation.original_text: S2K shall reimburse Distributor for all reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, including but not limited to: FINRA advertising/filing fees (including additional fees for expedited reviews as set forth in Section 2(b) herein).
perturbation.changed_text: S2K shall not reimburse Distributor for any expenses, including but not limited to: FINRA advertising/filing fees (including additional fees for expedited reviews as set forth in Section 2(b) herein).
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall reimburse' to 'shall not reimburse', this creates a direct contradiction regarding expense reimbursement obligations. This will likely lead to a dispute regarding who is responsible for covering these costs.
